title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:16 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
00:29 <Jacktrick> has quit  
00:42 <polx> has quit  
00:58 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:01 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:01 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
01:28 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:42 <rrodriguez> has quit  
03:53 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r109207e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/109207e1cb4efbcaef079954d594cb7bdbb0c94e / (7 files in 6 dirs): [cleanup] Refreshed code - http://git.io/gJuy1A  
05:06 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
05:40 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
05:41 <Denis> has quit  
05:44 <ssavi> has quit  
06:36 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:58 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
06:59 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis1> has quit  
07:16 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:22 <ssavi> has quit  
07:22 <ssavi\_> is now known as <ssavi>  
07:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:29 <vmassol> good morning  
07:29 <vmassol> reminder to self: don't comment on code before having had a breakfast....  
07:30 <jvelociter> has quit  
07:30 <faryshta> has quit  
07:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <vmassol> release day! (at last)  
08:17 <vmassol> eddy broke the build yesterday evening  
08:17 <vmassol> I sent him an email immediately but he hasn't responded  
08:17 <vmassol> so either we the fix the compile errors ourselves or we need to wait till he comes online....  
08:18 <vmassol> mflorea: gm, have you seen him?  
08:18 <+mflorea> vmassol: this morning no, I'll take a look at the compile error  
08:19 <vmassol> ok thxs  
08:19 <+mflorea> btw, you need to fix xmlrpc on manager  
08:19 <vmassol> ah didn't know about it, it's checking orphaned too?  
08:19 <+mflorea> it seems that we can remote the module altogether  
08:19 <vmassol> checking  
08:19 <+mflorea> s/remote/remove  
08:20 <+mflorea> yes, and it was doing only that  
08:20 <vmassol> ok cool  
08:20 <vmassol> indeed, removing  
08:23 <+mflorea> is someone working on Jenkins, it is going to shutdown, and 30min ago when I logged in it was coming back from a restart/shutdown  
08:23 <vmassol> I was  
08:23 <+mflorea> ok  
08:23 <vmassol> I'm done  
08:23 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* rdf641da https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/df641dade65f4c2ab05a069d10bfa68a55e5b6cd / (3 files in 3 dirs): Removed orphan test since XML XAR files are now verified by the XAR packaging lifecycle (see XCOMMONS-145: Add new Verify and Format Mojos in XAR plugin). - http://git.io/fWTxzQ  
08:24 <vmassol> (not something intelligent to do on release day but I had the urge to upgrade ;))  
08:24 <+tmortagne> there is also http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.manager$xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/747/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_WorkspaceManager\_u002C\_page\_Install\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ which is a real issue IMO  
08:24 <+tmortagne> looking at it  
08:39 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r5658dee https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5658dee6bb141172591c4294ba39a9af31ac6722 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/BaseCollection.java : XWIKI-7670: Make class references always local ...  
08:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: will this fix the webstandards issue?  
08:43 <+tmortagne> yes but it shows another one actually  
08:43 <vmassol> rf  
08:43 <vmassol> arf  
08:43 <+tmortagne> http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Install provide explicitely an absolute class reference to create an object which seems very weird to me  
08:44 <+tmortagne> but it's a far less problematic issue  
08:44 <+tmortagne>  #set ($searchSuggestConfigObject = $searchSuggestConfigDocument.newObject("$wikiName:XWiki.SearchSuggestSourceClass"))  
08:44 <+tmortagne> I don't understand why  
08:44 <+tmortagne> will need Edy  
08:46 <+tmortagne> maybe just too multiwiki enthusiast now that he is working on XEM :)  
08:47 <+mflorea> vmassol: re compilation error on annotation I can fix it with a cast, but there is another problem. Edy gets some configuration from an object which has some Boolean fields. Now, from my experience, the value of those fields is actually an int (0/1) and not a real Java boolean value, so if you use for instance AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource, you need to cast to Interger, not Boolean.  
08:47 <+tmortagne> vmassol: need to remove http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-test-xmlrpc/, right ?  
08:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: he is using AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource with a custom object ?  
08:50 <+mflorea> yes  
08:50 <+tmortagne> where is that ?  
08:50 <+mflorea> annotation-core  
08:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: indeed, removing  
08:51 <+mflorea> AnnotationConfigurationSource / DefaultAnnotationConfiguration  
08:51 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok  
08:52 <+tmortagne> before looking at the detail if the xclass attribute type is a boolean I think AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource should take this into account and that the way Edy is using it should be valid but it's a bit short to fix that before the release  
08:54 <+tmortagne> I see that AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource just let DocumentAccessBridge#getProperty decide  
08:55 <+mflorea> yep  
08:55 <+tmortagne> but I dontt think DocumentAccessBridge#getProperty should take care of this since it's supposed to follow XWikiDocument behavior  
08:55 <+mflorea> and I'm using the same method in WysiwygEditorConfiguration where I have a few boolean fields, and I'm casting the result to Integer  
08:56 <+mflorea> by same method I mean DAB#getProperty  
08:56 <+tmortagne> sure but it's a pitty IMO since AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource could easily know it's actually a boolean  
08:56 <+mflorea> yes  
08:56 <+tmortagne> hmm  
08:57 <+tmortagne> if Edy was passing a default value we could have made AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource check the type of the value and at least convert the value coming from DocumentAccessBridge accordingly as a first step  
08:58 <+mflorea> I can modify the code  
08:58 <+mflorea> although I'll assume the default value  
08:59 <+tmortagne> I guess the safest for now is probably to go throw an integer as you suggested since I think you can define the default value in the xclass  
08:59 <+tmortagne> through  
08:59 <+tmortagne> and create a jira issue for AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource and boolean values  
09:00 <+mflorea> ok  
09:00 <+tmortagne> problem is that making it return a boolean will break any code which is expecting an interger right now  
09:00 <+tmortagne> ha it's internal  
09:00 <+mflorea> yep  
09:00 <+tmortagne> so it's ok we can change whatever we want :)  
09:01 <vmassol> not really  
09:01 <vmassol> if it's internal it shouldn't be used by another module  
09:01 <vmassol> it's probably a mistake  
09:02 <+tmortagne> it should not be used by another module which is not sycnrhinized with the same version  
09:02 <vmassol> but yes we can go ahead and say "hey it was internal ;))"  
09:02 <+tmortagne> we alway use internal ouself  
09:02 <vmassol> not true  
09:02 <vmassol> it's forbidden for us too  
09:02 <vmassol> but  
09:02 <vmassol> we \*sometimes\* use it temporarily  
09:02 <vmassol> when an api is not ready for primetime  
09:02 <vmassol> because an internal that we use means it's not internal  
09:03 <vmassol> if we have the need others will too  
09:03 <+mflorea> I discussed with Edy about it yesterday and the "problem" is that everytime you want to take config from a custom object you need to duplicate code from AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource  
09:03 <vmassol> so it can only be temporary  
09:04 <+mflorea> if we make it generic, the problem is how to specify the page/class when injecting the configuration source  
09:04 <+tmortagne> anyway the point is that we can improve AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource  
09:04 <vmassol> yes  
09:04 <+tmortagne> mflorea: a provider  
09:04 <+tmortagne> well  
09:04 <+tmortagne> works only for teh default provider actually  
09:05 <+tmortagne> a custom provider will not be called for different hint actually  
09:06 <+tmortagne> then there is not much choice than a factory or a manager  
09:06 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <+tmortagne> either than or we change a bit the bahavior of providers and fallback on the default provider for a type when there is no provider for the provider hint  
09:07 <+tmortagne> not better actually since there is not way to pass the hint to a "real" provider, not like the default provider which has a special constructorr  
09:08 <+tmortagne> mflorea: so +1 to go the integer way for now  
09:09 <+mflorea> ok, I'm doing it  
09:09 <+tmortagne> we'll see later what we want to do with AbstractDocumentConfigurationSource  
09:10 <+tmortagne> it's not that easy to change it's behavior actually because any change to it will change XWikiPreference configuration source behavior  
09:13 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r717ae48 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/717ae48aa5d9cba752eb4471a796774e56a82c80 / (36 files in 11 dirs): Merge pull request #19 from sorinello/89d93de8670083520664a3eb0ab73e016f0dbb46 ...  
09:15 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r6fb847e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6fb847ee3107aeafbed99985ee362c3c17e03b1f / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml : An xobject xclass cannot come from another wiki than its document. - http://git.io/4ZJKzg  
09:17 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r30544c4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/30544c460ddce11fe9226abfa44f3dc35426639c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml : Improve codestyle - http://git.io/0DFf\_w  
09:17 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* radf7b9f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/adf7b9f9686c8950195f1c8463edef9f281777e7 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform - http://git.io/ubMiog  
09:20 <jvdrean> has quit  
09:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <vmassol> mflorea: forgot —rebase? :)  
09:23 <vmassol> ok I'm tackling the upgrade of http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building ….  
09:44 <+mflorea> vmassol: yes, but I tried it one, and it didn't behave as expected..  
09:44 <+mflorea> s/one/once  
09:45 <vmassol> once?  
09:45 <vmassol> we should always use it  
09:45 <vmassol> (except when on a branch I think - sergiu mentioned something)  
09:45 <vmassol> when you're on master you should always use it  
09:46 <vmassol> otherwise you create unnecessary ugly history  
09:46 <+mflorea> as I said, I tried it once and since it didn't work as expected, I did not use it  
09:46 <vmassol> and unnecessary commits  
09:46 <vmassol> (it creates one more commit for the merge)  
09:46 <+mflorea> git pull --rebase  
09:46 <vmassol> we all use it mflorea  
09:46 <vmassol> so you can be sure it works ;)  
09:47 <+mflorea> wdyd after git pull --rebase? git push?  
09:47 <vmassol> yes  
09:47 <vmassol> it replays the history so your local changes are put on top  
09:48 <vmassol> it removes your changes, get the changes from remote and put your changes on top  
09:48 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* r73545cf https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/73545cfe7fe9f77da243f73e041a56a2f5dafe51 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/internal/CheckAnnotationClassEventListener.java : Fix checkstyle - http://git.io/9Gzt8A  
09:48 <+mflorea> when I did this it told me I was diverging by 2 commits from the master, or something like that, and it didn't allow me to git push  
09:48 <vmassol> what can happen (in exterme condiitions)  
09:48 <vmassol> is that you make some refctorign like change directoies  
09:48 <vmassol> someone else does the same  
09:49 <vmassol> then you git pull --rebase  
09:49 <vmassol> it says there's a merge conflict  
09:49 <vmassol> (obviously)  
09:49 <vmassol> you resolve it  
09:49 <vmassol> you push  
09:49 <vmassol> a standard merge will do the same you'll also need to resolve the conflict  
09:50 <+mflorea> I didn't get any merge conflict when I tried it, anyway, I'll try it again  
10:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> ok building page updated  
10:34 <vmassol> ok so what's the status?  
10:34 <vmassol> (for the release)  
10:35 <vmassol> we should be good no?  
10:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: waiting for the build to be done  
10:36 <+tmortagne> last platform build was still failing (checkstyle issue this time)  
10:36 <vmassol> let's forbid anyone from committing without asking first!  
10:36 <vmassol> (actually best would be to create the release branch IMO)  
10:37 <+tmortagne> actually we are supposed to create the 4.0 branch anyway since it's 4.0RC1  
10:37 <vmassol> 4.0M2  
10:37 <vmassol> oh wait  
10:37 <+tmortagne> hmm  
10:37 <vmassol> you want to skip M2?  
10:38 <vmassol> checking rc date  
10:38 <+tmortagne> yes M2 sorry  
10:38 <vmassol> RC1 is 9 th  
10:38 <vmassol> ie in 4 business days  
10:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <ssavi> has left #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> jvdrean: what's your status?  
10:40 <vmassol> (and good morning!)  
10:40 <vmassol> jvdrean: you have XWIKI-7568 and XE-1117  
10:40 <jvdrean> has left #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> (see http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap)  
10:40 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <+Enygma`> good morning  
10:41 <vmassol> jvelociter: would be great to finish the doc for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-2551 (we need to close the issue for 4.0M2)  
10:42 <vmassol> has anyone tested jvelociter's LDAP UI?  
10:43 <vmassol> jvdrean: you also have http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-5949 assigned to you  
10:43 <vmassol> (listed in the roadmap)  
10:53 <+Enygma`> platform passed :) sorry for breaking it last night. I wonder why my local build of the module did not break on my machine.  
10:55 <+tmortagne> platform is ok now, waiting for manager test result and will start the release  
10:55 <+jvdrean> XWIKI-5949: I volunteered and I had code but it was before I see the issue created in the past by Marta, I didn't think about the issue with XObject properties (which is technically the biggest part of the issue)  
10:55 <+tmortagne> in the meantime please update the release note with your stuf  
10:55 <+jvdrean> XE-1117: the scope has been broadened, after discussing it with Caty we think it should be part of the homepage redesign (4.1)  
10:57 <+jvdrean> XWIKI-7568: even after discussing it again (extensively with Thomas last week) I still haven't found a good solution, the simple ones are hacks and the ones that seem better (stuff like DocumentQuery) aren't good either since they'd require new APIs with a "strongly typed" model (document and not generic "nodes")  
10:58 <vmassol> jvdrean: well you haven't sent any mail on the list explaining any issue...  
10:58 <vmassol> so how can we help you?  
10:58 <vmassol> you shouldn't wait till the last of the release  
10:58 <vmassol> to tell us about an issue you have!  
10:58 <vmassol> :)  
10:58 <vmassol> otehrwise I don't see how we can have this in the release  
10:59 <vmassol> (and this is the plan so far)  
11:01 <vmassol> we need to progress on this  
11:01 <vmassol> it's probably the most important item of the 4.0 release  
11:01 <+jvdrean> tmortagne helped a lot but I still don't have a proposal that feels right  
11:01 <vmassol> (for our users)  
11:26 <+tmortagne> ok jenkins seems staable, starting the release  
11:26 <+tmortagne> stable  
11:55 <+tmortagne> release script started, going out for lunch, I hope the script will not have any issue :)  
12:10 <+Enygma`> can we reference images from extensions.xwiki.org in release notes instead of attaching them to the release page?  
12:11 <+Enygma`> I mean, should we do that, or should we always attach to the release page to avoid missing images?  
12:13 <+Enygma`> actually, I`ll just add the image to the release page. I think it's better for the long run  
12:20 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
12:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you close the vote on supported db so I can update the documentation accordingly ?  
12:56 <vmassol> sburjan: yep  
12:59 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:02 <vmassol> sburjan: it wasnt a vote ;)  
13:03 <vmassol> anyway you can go ahead and create http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DatabaseSupportStrategy  
13:05 <+sburjan> ok. I will also add nice icons for the supported db's  
13:06 <+sburjan> and we'll need a macro maybe, same style as we have fro browsers  
13:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you give me 1mn to commit a small thing?  
13:08 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* red66194 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ed66194dfe4e2afd1d1d0cb6308ec6c7280fa998 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-index/xwiki-platform-index-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/DocumentsMacro.xml : XWIKI-7680: Duplicated "Content" macro category - http://git.io/Noa6qg  
13:09 <vmassol> ok I'm done  
13:11 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <mflorea> has quit  
13:25 <vmassol> evalica: you're jumping the gun :)  
13:25 <+evalica> :)  
13:25 <vmassol> I didnt close the issue because I'm still verifying if it's fixed  
13:25 <vmassol> have you checked?  
13:25 <+evalica> well I went to the select - saw that we have a capitalize - understood the problem - close it  
13:26 <+evalica> the CSS capitalized  
13:26 <+evalica> I though that you forgot to close it  
13:26 <vmassol> you committed something?  
13:26 <vmassol> I didn't forget!  
13:27 <vmassol> I'm testing :)  
13:27 <vmassol> still testing  
13:27 <vmassol> result in 2mn  
13:27 <+evalica> I can reopen it if you really want to … but I was just trying to help  
13:27 <+evalica> :) k  
13:29 <vmassol> ok it's working :)  
13:29 <vmassol> I need to fix some other part of the code though  
13:29 <vmassol> the MacroCategoryManager  
13:32 <vmassol> I'll need to discuss this with the others first, ie whether we want to be case-sensitive or not in categories  
13:39 <vmassol> this is quite nice: https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Build+Flow+Plugin  
13:40 <vmassol> not sure if we have the need but still nice ;)  
13:40 <+sburjan> xwiki.org is kinda of slow  
13:42 <vmassol> evalica: thanks for the report btw, I hadn't noticed the issue :)  
13:43 <vmassol> sburjan: you call that slow?  
13:43 <vmassol> for me it's completely borked!  
13:43 <+sburjan> but but but ... why ? :)  
13:43 <vmassol> have you created a circular look in your macro?  
13:44 <vmassol> :-P  
13:44 <+sburjan> don't think so :)  
13:44 <vmassol> \*loop  
13:44 <vmassol> (you cannot actually)  
13:44 <vmassol> (I put some code to prevent that in the macro transformation)  
13:48 <vmassol> sburjan: you should use smaller images  
13:49 <vmassol> it's more cost effective to have them in the right size  
13:49 <vmassol> you shouldn't scale them  
13:49 <+sburjan> vmassol: I'm not done yet  
13:49 <vmassol> you'e uploaded them!  
13:49 <vmassol> what's the point of uploading if you don't plan to use them? :)  
13:50 <vmassol> gotcha!  
13:51 <vmassol> cjd: hi, dunno if you've seen this http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7638 ?  
13:58 <vmassol> sburjan: http://speakerdeck.com/u/jeroenr/p/provisioning-with-vagrant-puppet  
13:58 <vmassol> check slide 5  
14:03 <+sburjan> bleah, don't like it..gonna make them bigger a little bit  
14:04 <vmassol> gem install vagrant-snap :)  
14:04 <vmassol> snap take, snap back, snap go  
14:04 <vmassol> very nice ;)  
14:04 <vmassol> (at the end of slides)  
14:05 <vmassol> one more nice tool to our box. So to summarize so far: vb, vagrant, veewee, maven, jenkins, jenkins vagrant plugin in, and vagrant-snap :)  
14:05 <vmassol> and puppet  
14:05 <vmassol> ofc  
14:06 <vmassol> I should spend more time on this…  
14:13 <+sburjan> I will read it, interested too, just to finish the macro  
14:20 <DrLou\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <+sburjan> vmassol: wdyt ? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/Database  
14:27 <+sburjan> do you like t he images >?

19:17 <CIA-120> Thomas Mortagne xwiki-manager-4.0-milestone-2 \* rfa2c321 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/fa2c32164665cc69a40701c12c7c02ea407b7863 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-manager-4.0-milestone-2 - http://git.io/QbxtZg  
19:17 <CIA-120> Thomas Mortagne xwiki-manager-4.0-milestone-2 \* re1372aa https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/e1372aa783bc6b5a18653ecb15e96af356feb145 / (16 files in 16 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-manager-4.0-milestone-2 - http://git.io/9j82tQ  
19:17 <vmassol> it's DocumentSheetClass right?  
19:17 <vmassol> reading  
19:18 <+mflorea> is a document has a sheet (custom or inherited from a class by having an object) then it will be used in inline mode  
19:18 <+tmortagne> maven release done  
19:18 <+mflorea> and yes, you can use DocumentSheetBinding to bing a custom sheet  
19:18 <vmassol> right, thanks.  
19:18 <+mflorea> s/is a document/if a document  
19:18 <vmassol> mflorea: to be precise  
19:19 <kshitij\_wikasta> has joined #xwiki  
19:19 <vmassol> we could have a DocumentSheetBinding on the Main.WebHome page and make that page use the inline mode  by default and when editing popup a dialog box asking the user to choose between edit the dashboard or edit the content in the editor, right?  
19:20 <vmassol> s/when editing/when the user clicks on edit/  
19:21 <+mflorea> yes, but this custom sheet must appear only in inline mode (so only edit mode), so you have to add a SheetDescriptor object to the sheet binded with DocumentSheetBinding, and set the action prop to "edit"  
19:22 <vmassol> cool  
19:22 <kshitij\_wikasta\_> has joined #xwiki  
19:22 <+mflorea> this way in view mode you're see Main.WebHome, because it doesn't have any view sheet associated, and in edit mode (inline because it has a sheet) it will use the sheet you bind
